instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..
definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A image problems
threads.message:
Hi,

I have a macbook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A with vertical stripes on the screen and a grey image, internal and external.

After disabling the GPU with medusa, and removing <RESISTOR>R8900</RESISTOR>, the mac keeps rebooting and don''t power on.

Is it CPU?

Can you help?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A image problems
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R8900</RESISTOR>, why?
<RESISTOR>R8904</RESISTOR>/11 are the resistors from power rails...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A image problems
threads.message:
My mistake.

Now, with  <RESISTOR>R8900</RESISTOR>  resoldered again, it is still rebooting. I think I have a corrupetd BIOS now (medusa is asking if Mac ROM is empty, but can read some information, and says that the stored BIOS is identical).

Do you have a CLEAN ME for this model please?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A image problems
threads.message:
Youy must do again Medusa mod on the BIOS.
<RESISTOR>R8904</RESISTOR>/11 must be removed BEFORE applying power.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A image problems
threads.message:
Hi,

It worked, but now on the loading bar, the Mac stops before ending. 

Any idea?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A image problems
threads.message:
Test in safe mode.

Try known good BIOS (clean ME).

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A image problems
threads.message:
Hi,

Do you have a clean ME BIOS for this model?
